main event: A round object the size of a planet was sighted in the Pacific Ocean on December 4, 1962, disappearing after five minutes.
interesting points: The object was sighted at 20-25 degrees, 210 azimuth by military observers., Observers believed the object to be a satellite, but no verification could confirm this., The object disappeared suddenly at a 195-degree azimuth., The sighting lasted approximately five minutes., There was a naval message that corroborated the sighting with similar details.
sighted object: round object the size of a planet
witness description: military personnel including officers and others who confirmed the sighting
